rules.natural: If the lab confirms an outbreak in the region, then the surveillance system detects an outbreak in the region.
Either the surveillance system issues a false alarm for the region, or the lab confirms an outbreak in the region.
Whenever the medical team uses a ventilator as a tool, they use an ambulance as a vehicle.
Either the government implements a lockdown in the city, or the government implements a quarantine in the city.

rules.prover9_expression: (implements_quarantine(government, city) -> (-(-natural_phenomenon(virus, spreads) -> has_vaccine(research_team, virus)) -> contains_outbreak(government, region)))
rules.natural: Should the government implement a quarantine in the city, then if it is not the case that the absence of the virus spreading leads to the research team having a vaccine, the government contains an outbreak in the region.

rules.prover9_expression: (deploys_team(government, medical_team) | (implements_lockdown(government, city) -> (-(-natural_phenomenon(virus, spreads) -> has_vaccine(research_team, virus)) -> contains_outbreak(government, region))))
rules.natural: Either the government deploys the medical team, or if the government implements a lockdown in the city, then the absence of the virus spreading implying the research team has a vaccine results in the government containing an outbreak in the region.
If the surveillance system detects an outbreak in the region, then the absence of the virus spreading implies that the research team has a vaccine for the virus.
Whenever it is false that the research team having a treatment leads to them having a vaccine, the medical team uses a ventilator as a tool.
Provided that it is not true that the research team having a treatment results in them having a vaccine, the medical team does not use an ambulance as a vehicle.
In the absence of the virus spreading, the research team has a treatment for the virus.
Should the virus not be spreading, then it is not the case that the research team has a vaccine for the virus.
